titles.title: Market Process Restoration Act of 1999
To restore the inherent benefits of the market economy by repealing the Federal body of statutory law commonly referred to as "antitrust law", and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.

bill.summary: 5/13/1999--Introduced. Market Process Restoration Act of 1999 - Repeals: (1) the Sherman Act; (2) the Clayton Act; (3) the Antitrust Civil Process Act; (4) the International Antitrust Enforcement Assistance Act of 1994; and (5) provisions of the Federal Trade Commission Act declaring unfair methods of competition in or affecting commerce to be unlawful.
